text: Acts chapter number 18 this evening. As we continue to prepare for our missions conference, it starts on Saturday with our opportunity to have our international banquet dinner and looking forward to it. I love missions conference. I just really do. I love revival meetings, but there's something special about the missions conference that almost has a mix of revival meeting and also the exposure and the awareness of world evangelization and the importance of fulfilling our responsibility and how we can be co-laborers together. It's just an exciting time. I absolutely love missions conference and I'm looking forward to with great anticipation of what God is going to do. I find it vitally important that we are prepared spiritually when we enter into these special meetings. I was sharing with somebody even this afternoon that the first year, year and a half of pastoring, I would always feel very conflicted when we were entering into a season of a special meeting, a missions conference or revival meeting, and I felt like as I was praying about what to preach that the Holy Spirit of God was leading me into a direction with regard to preaching, but then I felt like I can't preach on those subjects because that's what they're going to preach on. That's what the evangelist is gonna be preaching on. That's what the missionary is gonna be preaching on and I would feel somewhat conflicted and have this internal struggle, if you will, and I remember having a conversation with Brother Palmer, Sean, a great friend, mentor of mine, and he said this. He worked in evangelism for years, he still does, and he says, you know, the more work that a pastor does in preparing the congregation for a special meeting, the greater work that God is able to accomplish. He said, what I found throughout the years of ministry is that a church can either be revival resistant or revival ready, and I thought that was quite interesting and it really gave me a sense of relief. Of course, I desired to follow the leadership of the Holy Spirit of God. It was my brain that was getting in the way and causing the conflict on whether I should or shouldn't preach on those particular things, and if you've not preached before, you might not understand that, but that's just something occasionally that you deal with, and so I desire personally, but I desire for our church to be prepared for the special meetings. I've talked to missionaries before that they enter into a church and they're telling me these firsthand accounts, and so I'm just believing that what they're telling me is true, and they enter into a church, they enter in, and there will be some members that will be standing in the foyer area, maybe on a porch or whatever the greeting area is that the particular church has, and the members will say, oh, how are you today? We want to see that in Spain and all of these other fields, but we must not lose sight of the fact that it has to be done here as well. It has to be done here as well. It starts in Jerusalem, and this, as we make application, this is our Jerusalem. He says both, it's to be all at the same time, and we strategically approach that through supporting missionaries that are going around the globe. And I hope that by the end of the missions conference next week that we'll be able to partner with two brand new missionaries and be able to support them financially and add them to our list as missionaries of the Fellowship Baptist Church that we've partnered with and we can begin supporting them financially and praying for them, and I trust that that will be what happens. But we never can lose sight of the fact that that over there does not replace what we're supposed to be doing here. It's not enough to just put money in an offering plate or to pray for a missionary and say, okay, I've done my part, both. God said He had much people in that city, the city of Corinth, a wicked, immoral, idolatrous people, but they needed to be saved by the grace of God. You say, do you know how bad our county is? Do you know all the problems we have? There's a lot of them, but they're sinners that need to be saved. Why would we, and I know I've said this before, it's hard enough to get a saved person to act like a saved person. You're never going to get a lost person to act like a saved person. They don't understand the Scripture. They don't have the Holy Spirit of God living within them. They need to be saved. This evening, God has a work for us and this is our place. This is where God has us. I believe that God wants to use us to reach people with the gospel for His glory, not for any of our glory, but for His glory. God said I have much people in this city. Let's pray. Father, we love You. We thank You for loving us. We thank You for Your Word and the truth contained therein and I pray, God, that You would help us to serve You passionately. Help us to claim the promises that You've given us. Help us to continue. We see the persistence of Paul. Help us not to give up or to give in. Help us not to be overwhelmed. Lord help us to continue. I pray that You'd move and work in hearts and lives as only you can. We'll give you the honor and glory for it. For it's in Christ's name we pray.
